newsitem.title: SRI LANKA: Sri Lanka stocks move up on back of blue chip.
newsitem.headline: Sri Lanka stocks move up on back of blue chip.

text.p: Sri Lanka stocks edged up in early Monday trade, led by a blue chip which was rising on growth prospects, brokers said.
At 0500 GMT the all share was 4.6 points up at 743.90. The highly capitalised blue chip Hayleys Ltd rose four rupees to 249.
"Hayleys is rising because some brokers have said the company should see a 15 percent rise in profits in the year to March 1987," said a broker who declined to be identified.
The company's profits rose 32.5 percent to 283.15 million rupees in the year to March 1997.
Brokers say the final turnover could rise substantially if they can find sellers of big volumes of blue chips.
"There is significant demand for big quantities of John Keells Holdings at between 250 and 255 rupees, but there are no sellers at all at those levels," said one.
